title: How to Make Venison Vegetable Soup from Scratch

steps.headline: On a clean meat-only cutting board with a sharp knife cube up a 2-4 lb.
steps.description: raw venison roast into bite sized pieces. (About ½ an inch to an inch depending on taste.)

steps.headline: Put roast into crock pot on high with 2-3 cups of water and 2 low sodium beef bouillon cubes.
Allow to cook for approximately 2 hours.
Drain liquid from venison chunks and place liquid into a small saucepan.
Add to crock pot 1 can (14-16 oz.)
steps.description: of tomato sauce, placing crock pot on low heat.

steps.headline: While venison and tomato sauce are cooking make gravy from venison au jus.
In a stock pot in 1 quart of water add 4 medium sized potatoes that have been cubed into ½ inch pieces cut on a clean veggie cutting board with a sharp knife.
steps.description: (You can leave peels on if they are soft, or remove them if desired.)

steps.headline: Add to stock pot 2 low sodium beef bouillon cubes, 1 tsp.
steps.description: of Kitchen Bouquet,  and 1-1lb bag of baby carrots.Bring this mixture to a low to medium boil for 15 minutes.

steps.headline: Add ½ to 1lb of clean, snapped garden fresh green beans and continue to boil.
Add 2 cups of fresh snapped peas out of pod.
Next add 4 ears of de-cobbed corn and continue to boil.
Add during boil 1-2 ribs of celery (depending upon taste) and continue to boil for an additional  3 minutes.
Strain all veggies from stock and set stock aside for later use.
Add veggies to crock pot and return crock pot to high heat.
Add stock until the soup has reached the consistency just slightly thinner than what is desired.
Add salt, pepper, garlic, minced onion, parsley flakes, and paprika to taste.
steps.description: (Real garlic and onion may be substituted, and is preferred my many.)

steps.headline: Allow to simmer, cook, and mingle for 20–30 minutes.

text: On a clean meat-only cutting board with a sharp knife cube up a 2-4 lb. raw venison roast into bite sized pieces. (About ½ an inch to an inch depending on taste.) Put roast into crock pot on high with 2-3 cups of water and 2 low sodium beef bouillon cubes.  Allow to cook for approximately 2 hours.  Drain liquid from venison chunks and place liquid into a small saucepan.  Add to crock pot 1 can (14-16 oz.) of tomato sauce, placing crock pot on low heat. While venison and tomato sauce are cooking make gravy from venison au jus. Add gravy to crockpot. In a stock pot in 1 quart of water add 4 medium sized potatoes that have been cubed into ½ inch pieces cut on a clean veggie cutting board with a sharp knife. (You can leave peels on if they are soft, or remove them if desired.) Add to stock pot 2 low sodium beef bouillon cubes, 1 tsp. of Kitchen Bouquet,  and 1-1lb bag of baby carrots.Bring this mixture to a low to medium boil for 15 minutes. Add ½ to 1lb of clean, snapped garden fresh green beans and continue to boil.  Add 2 cups of fresh snapped peas out of pod.  Next add 4 ears of de-cobbed corn and continue to boil.  Add during boil 1-2 ribs of celery (depending upon taste) and continue to boil for an additional  3 minutes.  Strain all veggies from stock and set stock aside for later use.  Add veggies to crock pot and return crock pot to high heat.  Mix all ingredients well.  Add stock until the soup has reached the consistency just slightly thinner than what is desired.  Add salt, pepper, garlic, minced onion, parsley flakes, and paprika to taste. (Real garlic and onion may be substituted, and is preferred my many.) Allow to simmer, cook, and mingle for 20–30 minutes.  Finished.
